Life As A Data Analyst

Data analysts spend their workdays digging into big data and making it useable Generally speaking, a data analyst will retrieve and gather data, organize it and use it to reach meaningful conclusions. “Data analysts’ work varies depending on their industry and the type of data that they’re working with (sales, social media, inventory, etc.) as well as the specific client project.

Everyone interested in working with data would do well to learn data analysis, and attending our institution can have many advantages both professionally and financially. Here are a few reasons: for the company they work for.

Career Advantages

High Demand

There is a high need for knowledgeable data analysts, and there are many employment openings in this area. You can access a variety of employment prospects in a variety of sectors, such as banking, healthcare, e-commerce, and more, by becoming an expert in data analysis.

Professional Advancement

Gaining knowledge of data analysis paves the way for promotions to more senior positions within your company. This is due to the fact that data-driven decision making is becoming more and more significant across a wide range of industries, and businesses need personnel who can evaluate data and offer insightful analysis to inform strategic decision making.

Flexibility

Because data analysis abilities are in demand across many industries, and countries, you can pick a career path that interests you. This flexibility is valuable for professionals who want to work in a field they enjoy.

What career will this programme prepare me for?

  • Financial Analyst

  • Business Intelligence Analyst

  • Operations Analyst

  • Data Visualisation Developer

  • Marketing Analytics Specialist

  • Healthcare Data Analyst

High Earning Potential:

The profession of data analysis pays well, has space for advancement, and offers competitive salaries. The typical annual income for a data analyst is between $40,000 – $70,000; with experience, this salary can rise dramatically.

Possibilities for Consulting:

Many data analysts opt to work independently as consultants, offering their services to clients who need assistance with data analysis. As a result, there’s a chance for even bigger earnings and more financial freedom.

  • Customer Insights Analyst

  • Risk Management Analyst

Data analyst career coaching

With access to a wealth of resources and the support of a dynamic community of learners and professionals, you will have everything you need to become a successful data analyst..

Frequently Asked Questions

HOW MUCH WILL IT COST TO LEARN DATA ANALYSIS IN NIGERIA?

The cost of learning data analysis in Nigeria can vary depending on several factors such as the level of expertise you aim to achieve, the institution or platform you choose for learning, the duration of the course, and any additional materials or resources required. Here are some common options and their approximate costs:

Online Courses: Many online platforms such as pdma offer courses in data analysis. These courses can range from few to several thousand naira, depending on the level of the course, the reputation of the instructor, and whether you opt for a certificate upon completion.

Bootcamps: Data analysis bootcamps are intensive, short-term programs designed to provide practical skills quickly. The cost of these bootcamps can vary widely, ranging from a few hundred thousand to several million naira, depending on the program's duration and reputation.

Self-Study: If you prefer a more flexible and cost-effective option, you can also learn data analysis through self-study using free online resources such as tutorials, blogs, YouTube videos, and textbooks. While this option may not incur direct costs, it requires discipline and self-motivation to follow through with your learning plan.

CAN I LEARN DATA ANALYSIS IN 3 MONTHS?

Yes, it is possible to learn data analysis in three months, especially if you dedicate significant time and effort to your learning. However, the depth of your understanding and proficiency will depend on various factors such as your prior knowledge, the intensity of your study schedule, and the resources you utilize.

Here's a general roadmap you might follow to learn data analysis in three months:

  1. Foundational Knowledge (1st Month):

    • Start by understanding the basics of statistics, probability, and mathematics, which form the foundation of data analysis.
    • Learn programming languages commonly used in data analysis such as Python or R. Focus on understanding basic syntax, data structures, and control flow.
    • Familiarize yourself with essential data manipulation techniques using libraries like Pandas (for Python) or dplyr (for R).

  2. Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) (2nd Month):

    • Dive deeper into data visualization techniques to explore and understand datasets visually.
    • Learn how to clean and preprocess data effectively, handling missing values, outliers, and inconsistencies.
    • Explore statistical techniques for analyzing data distributions, correlations, and relationships between variables.

  3. Advanced Techniques and Tools (3rd Month):

    • Study more advanced statistical methods such as hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and machine learning algorithms.
    • Gain proficiency in using libraries like Scikit-learn (for Python) or caret (for R) for implementing machine learning models.
    • Practice real-world data analysis projects to apply your knowledge and skills in practical scenarios.
WHAT IF I AM NOT CLOSE TO THE VENUE OF THE TRAINING?

If you live far from the training location and can't come to class regularly, you can join our virtual classes or use our online platform. It lets you learn at your own speed and convenience. Visit pdmaonline.com to learn more about our digital marketing courses online.

WHICH CERTIFICATION IS THE BEST?

At the and of your training, we give you a professional diploma in data analytics certification. 

WHAT DATA ANALYSIS TRAINING DOES PDMA OFFER?

PDMA offers several digital marketing training programs, including in-class training, corporate training, and online training.

HOW MUCH DOES DATA ANALYSIS TRAINING COST IN NIGERIA?

The cost of a data analytics course in Nigeria can vary depending on the academy, but you should budget between 400,000 to 500,000 Naira.

CAN THE PAYMENTS BE DONE IN INSTALLMENTS FOR YOUR DATA ANALYSIS COURSE?

Yes, you can make payments in installments for our data analytics course, but the full payment should be completed before the class ends.

IS THERE A CERTIFICATE AT THE END OF THE DATA ANALYSIS PROGRAM?

Yes. Upon completion of the data analytics training, you will receive a certificate. 

Our training programs include: In-class training, Corporate training, and Online training

WHAT DOES A DATA ANALYSIS COURSE COST IN NIGERIA?

The cost of a data analysis course can vary depending on the academy. In Nigeria, you should budget about 350,000 Naira.
